TopicTitle: Harnessing the Kraken: Eeloo in 11 hours!

Articles.Content:
A good way to summon a kraken is to attempt Jool landing with some super-heavy remote-control craft. It ends up in a spray of debris. Usually flyning away from the solar system.

Also there are some random krakens, i accidentaly hit a munarch when EVA on a rover. Got shot into sun at 6 times speed of light (approx.) However. i've done this like 1000 times and only happened once back in .22
So, I made this today, tested the initial concept a little last night, the video shows how this works up close.

Mental block atm. Haven't had any new ideas on how to improve the device today and testing hasn't yielded any new discoveries.

Trying to copy Andrew123s ftl glitch has just resulted in more gyro Kraken attacks. It doesn't want to give up its secrets easily. I know its possible because being flung across the system at ftl speeds isn't unheard of.

I'm going to split my research between this Anti Gravity engine and the stock warp drive attempts.

Mental block atm. Haven't had any new ideas on how to improve the device today and testing hasn't yielded any new discoveries.

Trying to copy Andrew123s ftl glitch has just resulted in more gyro Kraken attacks. It doesn't want to give up its secrets easily. I know its possible because being flung across the system at ftl speeds isn't unheard of.

I'm going to split my research between this Anti Gravity engine and the stock warp drive attempts.

Well, here's the craft file for my version of your reactor.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/80346/AG%20%20Reactor.craft

I think the agr's and ftl drive go hand in hand if you want to make a real stock sci-fi-ey ship.

Where is the stock ftl thread anyway?

Oh, and fair warning, the ship may only work once the first time you launch the game, or may just be very prone to failure on initialization.

Behold, Kraken powered flight!

Way back before the great forum derp, I had a practical application of the FTL Egg as part of an Eve return mission.

The ship had to be customised for the mission, so it was no magical single-stage-to-anywhere craft, but it got the job done.
Why not try using airplane landing gear pushing a wheel, and then turning the wheel, causing some odd physics glitch to occur, pushing the ship in some direction? Zefram Kerman is on the job!

Way back before the great forum derp, I had a practical application of the FTL Egg as part of an Eve return mission.

I remember that being posted I think. Lightest Eve return vehicle challenge if I remember correctly?

I remember that being posted I think. Lightest Eve return vehicle challenge if I remember correctly?

They did discuss it on that thread, but I made it for a different challenge. There was a thread to see how many bodies were possible to reach using a 30 tonne vehicle. Eve got listed as "impossible". I disagreed.
Ahh Geb, I remember that I always found it funny seeing the big hulk of metal attached to the pod and not affecting it at all.

Ok after a few days of research my observations and theories are as follows:

-The basic idea is two pieces are pushed away from each other while the game attempts to correct this and tries to pull them together again.

-The landing gear seems to have to travel through an intermediate piece to produce thrust. I'm not sure why but this somehow unbalances the forces.

-Rune discovered that the device acts differently depending on the frame of reference.

-Both the lightspeed kraken and the gyrokraken are caused by the same bug in how the game calculates forces.

-Tricking the game into thinking that there is an incredibly high force acting on the device may allow for very high speed to be reached.

-This force could be applied by compressing several parts together and then through each other.

Note that these are all just theories and so may be completely wrong. If someone knows otherwise i'll correct these.
Just watch some Danny2462 videos!

I'm hoping that Danny2462 discovers this. He'll modify it in some way to cause untold terror to the poor kerbals. (And probably invent the stock warp drive while he's at it.)

Ok, I have nine pages to catch up, but I have just posted the first KrakenDrive powered ship ready for the consumer market over at the spacecraft exchange. Enjoy!

Rune. After all, we live in a universe of infiniglide and magic reaction wheels, never mind the lift/drag model.

I hope they fix the bug, but this is fascinating to watch... haven't had much success actually using them, though. Far Star Gonad Trevithick tragically exploded on transition to Krakendrive powered flight...

I hope they fix the bug, but this is fascinating to watch... haven't had much success actually using them, though. Far Star Gonad Trevithick tragically exploded on transition to Krakendrive powered flight...

You didn't read the "don't engage the drive inside an atmosphere unless you are going really slow" sign, did you? Better luck next flight!

Rune. I knew I put the kerbal on an easy-to-detach abort-grouped capsule far from the drive for a reason.
I wish I could release my slipspace drive, but the rather kraken prone track record makes it a rather dangerous idea... I guess ships indeed need gellard fields.

Now that we have a way of defying gravity:

Are we happy now?

Oh, some maths:

Eeloo is about 100,000,000,000 meters away from Kerbin at any given time.

My ship can accelerate at about 270 m/s^2.

2 * sqrt(100000000000/270)=~38490 seconds required to get to Eeloo via Brachistochrone trajectory.

Top speed will be 5196150 m/s or 0.017 C.

38490 seconds is 10.69 hours, which means I could go to Eeloo and come back in under 21.2 hours. The entire solar system is reachable and not only that but returnable in one day.

And thanks to my ship's extreme stability, I could just leave it running for the entire time.

Continued development has yielded this amazing result! Though the drive has yet to be tested for this long.
I have another idea on this I'm going to give a try in a little bit..if it works it will cut down the part count dramatically for the drive.

I'm amazed that no one has made a battleship with 4 of these things covered in armor and powering the ship.

Actually, I'll put one in as a subassembly, and make a hulk of a ship, covered in armor and all, with room for a few of these.

I'll name it Hell Summoner, since it's basically summoning the satanic kraken.
Somebody make the Enterprise E with this!
